intro: Tarenaya costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican tarenaya, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. It produces showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
